citation.article-title: Isolation and characterization of Caldicellulosiruptor lactoaceticus sp. nov., an extremely thermophilic, cellulolytic, anaerobic bacterium.

p.s: Description of Caldicellulosiruptor lactoaceticus sp. nov.

Caldicellulosiruptor lactoaceticus (lac.to.acéticus. N.L. adj. lacticum, lactic; N.L. adj. aceticum, acetic. N.L. lactoaceticum, neut. adj. referring to production of lactic and acetic acids as major fermentation products)
Morphology
Rods, 1.5-3.5x0.7 μm with rounded ends.
Cells occur singly, in pairs or short chains and stain gram-negative.
Endospores not found.
Non-motile.
No flagella.
Colony characteristics Colonies are 1 mm in diameter, round, white, opalescent, circular, with an entire edge after incubation in agar roll tubes for approximately 1 week.
Physiology
Obligately anaerobe.
Chemoorganoheterotroph.
Optimum temperature for growth near 68°C, maximum temperature near 78°C minimum temperature near 50°C.
The optimum pH for growth is at approximately 7.0; no growth occurs at pH near 9.0 or 5.6.
Growth with Avicel, cellobiose, lactose, maltose, pectin, soluble starch, xylan and xylose.

Does not grow on acetate, arabinose, arbutin, casein peptone, dextran, ethanol, fructose, galactose, glucose, lactate, mannitol, mannose, methanol, pyruvate, D-ribose, raffinose, rhamnose, sorbitol, sucrose, trehalose, yeast extract or H2/CO2.
The fermentation products are lactate and acetate, with smaller amounts of ethanol.
CO2 and H2 are also produced.
The bacterium does not form H2S from sulfate, thiosulfate or sulfite, and nitrate does not stimulate growth.
Complete growth inhibition by ampicillin, chloramphenicol, kanamycin, neomycin, streptomycin sulfate, penicillin V, tetracycline, vancomycin (each at 10 μg/ml).
The bacterium is resistant to D-cycloserine (100 μg/ml).
Genotypical characteristics
DNA base composition of 35.2±0.8 mol% G + C.
The bacterium has 96.3% sequence similarity in the 16S rDNA gene with Caldicellulosiruptor saccharolytricus TP8T.6331 (Rainey et al. 1994).
Habitat
Cyanobacterial mats and cellulosic materials, e.g., wood and straw, in slightly alkaline Icelandic thermal springs.
Type strain
Caldicellulosiruptor lactoaceticus 6A has been deposited with the Deutsche Sammlung von Mikroorganismen, DSM strain no. 9545.
